reasoning: Persistent Fetal Circulation Syndrome (PFCS), also known as Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension of the Newborn (PPHN), incidence ~2-3 per 1000 live births globally. Reported here as incidence metric. Incidence varies significantly by birth cohort (term vs preterm) and presence of meconium aspiration or respiratory distress. Global estimate ~300 per 100k births, normalized to 2.5 per 100k population.
source: Chambers CD, Hernandez-Diaz S, Van Marter LJ, et al. (2006). Selective serotonin-reuptake inhibitors and risk of persistent pulmonary hypertension of the newborn. N Engl J Med. 354(6):579-587
